Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): add back ngcc as a no-op with a warning
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

The Angular Compatibility Compiler is removed in Angular 16 and therefore, `ngcc` is no longer available in users' workspaces. In some setups, `ngcc` is invoked in the `postinstall` script of the `package.json`. When updating Angular, in scenarios where `postinstall` is run (e.g. Nx migrations), this throws an error before a migration can remove the `ngcc` invocation. This makes the update process to be more complicated.

## What is the new behavior?

`ngcc` is available as a no-op operation. When invoked, it will warn, providing details about removing `ngcc`. It gives some context at the tool level to folks who haven't caught up with news that `ngcc` was removed.

**Note:** In Angular 17, this will be removed.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

I chose to inline some slightly modified functionality from chalk for the colors in the console. I did that to avoid adding an extra dependency for this. I'm open to adding the dependency instead or implementing a different way to get colors in the console in a cross-platform way if preferred.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): add back ngcc as a no-op with a warning" (#50045)

Issues.Title: Parser doesn't throw an error when a data bind only contains a comment
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

A data bind in the form of `{{//comment}}` in a component HTML file causes the compiler to freak out because something is undefined. I assume this should be handled in the same way `{{}}` is by throwing a Parser Error.

------------
**Similar data binds that correctly produce a Parser Error and their corresponding errors:**
- `{{}}`
	- `Error: src/app/app.component.html:16:1 - error NG5002: Parser Error: Blank expressions are not allowed in interpolated strings`
- `{{/*hello*/}}`
	- `Error: src/app/app.component.html:9:1 - error NG5002: Parser Error: Unexpected token /`
- `{{#!/usr/bin/env node}}`
	- `Error: src/app/app.component.html:11:1 - error NG5002: Parser Error: Lexer Error: Invalid character [#]`
	- `Error: src/app/app.component.html:11:1 - error NG5002: Parser Error: Unexpected token Lexer Error: Invalid character [#]`

Issues.Title: fix(core): allow passing value of any type to `isSignal` function
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

To check if a value of type `unknown` is a Signal, we need to add two conditions:

```ts
import { isSignal } from '@angular/core';

declare const potentialSignal: unknown;

const isSig = typeof potentialSignal === 'function' && isSignal(potentialSignal);
```

## What is the new behavior?

The first condition is not needed anymore, so we can call the `isSignal` function and pass the argument of type `unknown`:

```ts
import { isSignal } from '@angular/core';

declare const potentialSignal: unknown;

const isSig = isSignal(potentialSignal);
```

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes

Issues.Title: esbuild failed to process css background images
Issues.Body:
### Command build ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description Error while processing images as css background images ### Minimal Reproduction place any image with name "timeline.png" to assets folder ```html
``` ```css .container { width: 300px; height: 300px; border: 1px solid red; background-image: url("~/src/assets/timeline.png") } ``` Works perfectly with default builder, but `browser-esbuild` could not resolve it ### Exception or Error ```text Could not resolve "~/src/assets/timeline.png" [plugin angular-css-resource] apps/esbuild-app/src/app/app.component.css:6:24: 6 │ background-image: url("~/src/assets/timeline.png") ╵ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You can mark the path "~/src/assets/timeline.png" as external to exclude it from the bundle, which will remove this error. ``` ### Your Environment ```text _ _ ____ _ ___ / \ _ __ __ _ _ _| | __ _ _ __ / ___| | |_ _| / △ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__| | | | | | | / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | | | |___| |___ | | /_/ \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_| \____|_____|___| |___/ Angular CLI: 15.2.7 Node: 18.13.0 Package Manager: npm 9.2.0 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 15.2.8 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1502.7 @angular-devkit/build-angular 15.2.7 @angular-devkit/core 15.2.7 @angular-devkit/schematics 15.2.7 @angular/cli 15.2.7 @schematics/angular 15.2.7 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 4.9.5 ``` ### Anything else relevant? I use fresh nx project Looks like same problem as #24470
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "esbuild failed to process css background images" (#25089)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): always enable `looseEnums` build optimizer rule
Issues.Body: With this change TypeScript enums are always processing in "loose" mode. Previously, this was only done for `@angular/` packages.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Easily and continuously experiment with esbuild-based builder" (#25087)

Issues.Title: refactor: replace `node` with `process.execPath`
Issues.Body: This is ensure that the same node executable is used to spawn Jest
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: replace `node` with `process.execPath`" (#25085)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): do not inline sourcemap when using vite dev-server
Issues.Body:
Vite inlines the source map as part of content (https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/ba62be40b4f46c98872fb10990b559fee88f4a29/packages/vite/src/node/server/send.ts#L59-L63) with no option to disable this behaviour. While this is improves performances when Vite is used without prebundling. When using prebundling this is causes an overhead as the response can grow drastically, in some cases over 50mb.

Closes #25012
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): do not inline sourcemap when using vite dev-server" (#25082)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): exclude `@angular/platform-server/init` from unsafe optimizations
Issues.Body: `@angular/platform-server/init` entry-point is side-effectful and thus it's not safe to perform advanced optimizations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): exclude `@angular/platform-server/init` from unsafe optimizations" (#25083)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): provide migration that disables build optimizer on dev server builds
Issues.Body: In https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/25070 we turned on `buildOptimizer` by default for server builds. This causes existing projects development builds to always run build-optimizer. This migration will set `buildOptimizer` to false, when `optimization` is disabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): provide migration that disables build optimizer on dev server builds" (#25084)

Issues.Title: Request to implement Idle timeout for ng serve process
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Description

Hi there,
I would like to know if we have any feature that would kill or terminate the ng serve process automatically (without pressing ctrl + c manually) where requests are not being served for more than n minutes.

Why I need it?
most of the time, while doing multi-tasking, I forget to manually kill ng serve command even long after switching to another task or leaving the computer on and moving out of desk. ng serve keeps on running taking ˜2GB of ram blocking for other processes. so, its better to auto kill "ng serve" process when requests are not being served for more than n mins.

I am not sure if any similar feature is already there.
I hope other people would also be facing same issue especially on Mac M1 where I don't have option to upgrade my RAM. 

### Describe the solution you'd like


probably an idle timer implementation to auto stop ng serve process.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I currently don't think of any good alternative.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Request to implement Idle timeout for ng serve process" (#25073)

Issues.Title: esbuild-based builder code cleanup/refactoring
Issues.Body:
The TypeScript diagnostic to esbuild diagnostic conversion utilities are now contained in a
separate file. This lowers the line count of the main compiler plugin file and also removes
an additional direct usage of the `typescript` dependency from the compiler plugin file.

The stylesheet related files for the esbuild-based browser application builder
have now been moved into a `stylesheets` directory to better organize the code.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): provide option to run build-optimizer on server bundles
Issues.Body:
This commit adds the option to run build-optimizer on the server bundles.

This is needed as in some cases, there can be restrictions on the size of server bundles that can be executed. One of these cases is CloudFlare workers
 which by default does not work with an `ng-new` application due to the size of the
 bundle mainly due to the retention of the `@angular/compiler`.

//cc @AndrewKushnir
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): provide option to run build-optimizer on server bundles" (#25070)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid double sourcemap comments with esbuild dev-server
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with the dev-server builder, sourcemap URL comments were unintentionally doubled due to vite adding an additional inline sourcemap comment when processing the JavaScript files for the application. To avoid this, JavaScript files now have any sourcemap URL comments removed prior to being processed by vite. The sourcemap content is already passed directly to vite and allows the sourcemaps to be processed and provided to the browser as needed without the previously existing sourcemap URL comment. The removal is done without modifying the esbuild-based builder's options to avoid assuming the builder used with the dev-server has sourcemap options that allow hidden sourcemap generation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid double sourcemap comments with esbuild dev-server" (#25065)

Issues.Title: fix(material/dialog): opening animation sometimes being skipped
Issues.Body:
When we trigger a dialog animation, we set a CSS variable and a couple of classes to start it, however because we were adding the classes imemdiately after setting the variable, sometimes the animation would be skipped because the browser didn't have time to recalculate the styles.

These changes resolve the issue by adding the classes in a `requestAnimationFrame` which gives the browser enough time to pick up the animation duration.

Fixes #26931.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/dialog): opening animation sometimes being skipped" (#26971)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Chips): _chips is not documented. Unclear of intent of property
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

In Material v14 you could access the chips of a MatChipList using the `chips` property. With the update to v15 and new classes, MatChipListBox exposes this property `_chips`. Due to common usage of a underscore to denote private properties this causes confusion on whether this should be a publicly accessible property.  Could we get some insights on the intentionality of this property and whether its ok for use in app code land. 

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/chips/api#MatChipSet

Issues.Title: feat(all components): Test id attributes for internal elements
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

The v15 mdc merge has just butchered our e2e suite.

There are no known safe mechanisms to target material component internals e.g. a selected pseudo checkbox in a list item,. Until now we have targeted class names, but this has just suffered a monumental amount of breaking changes.

Suggest adding non-changeable `data-test-{target-name}` to targetable internals.

### Use Case

`cy.get('mat-option:not(.mdc-list-item--selected)')`

see: https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices#Selecting-Elements

Issues.Title: Update generate schematics to support standalone
Issues.Body:
Updates the various `ng generate` schematics to support standalone projects and the `--standalone` flag. Includes:
* Adding a `--standalone` flag to all the schematics, similar to `ng generate component`, but also inferring if the project is standalone based on its structure. Inferring is necessary, because the CLI utilities for adding an import to the root module will throw an error if a root module doesn't exist.
* Updating some of the authoring utilities not to look for modules if the app is standalone.
* Having the schematics generate a standalone component with the correct `imports`.
* Not adding `imports` and `declarations` to the testing module.
* Not adding `imports` and `declarations` to the root module.
* Using `inject` instead of constructor injection in the generated component. This is unrelated to standalone, but is a best practice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update generate schematics to support standalone" (#26978)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-select): Improve mat-select harness DX
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Currently, when using `matSelectHarness.getOptions()`, an empty array is returned if the `matSelectHarness.open()` method is not called beforehand. This can be confusing for users, who may not realize they need to call `matSelectHarness.open()` first.

To improve the user experience, I suggest adding an error message similar to what is done in `matAutoCompleteHarness`, so that if `getOptions()` is called before `open()`, an error will be thrown informing the user to call `open()` first.

This change would save users time and frustration by providing immediate feedback on what they need to do to correctly use the `getOptions()` method.

matAutoComplete implementation:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/22e928c4fce56fc3619e7aecd0affbb8972847ae/src/material/autocomplete/testing/autocomplete-harness.ts#L80


I can make a PR for it :)

Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(mat-select): Improve mat-select harness DX" (#26986)

Issues.Title: bug(table): `renderRows` doesn't trigger change detection in content projection
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Please see the Stackblitz. This is a particular case. However, running `renderRows` on the projected table component doesn't trigger change detection for this child component. Although this behaviour seems correct for the _OnPush_ strategy, I am still looking for ways to make this example work. This isn't particularly a matter only of `renderRows`, but the same behaviour is observed while using Observables or custom Data source.

In other words, how can I set the `dataSource` from the wrapper component and make it run the change detection without actually modifying the projected (child) component?

### Expected Behavior

The data source will run the change detection and display table body content.

### Actual Behavior

The table is empty, and no data is projected due to a missing change detection run. Manually running change detection from inside the child component is needed.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.8
- CDK/Material: 15.2.8
- Browser(s): Version 112.0.5615.137 (Official Build) (arm64) 
- Operating System: macOS

Issues.Title: feat(input): customize never empty input types
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Allow defining a custom set of "never empty" input types, maybe with a new injection token such as `MAT_INPUT_NEVER_EMPTY_TYPES`, which would then be used by the `matInput` directive when determining whether an input is empty, and whether the label should float. 

Basically some way to override this code: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/524c243f37420493993f63e0880d972c584bc36d/src/material/input/input.ts#L267-L274

### Use Case

I want to use `<input matInput type="datetime-local">` and `<input matInput type="time">` in `<mat-form-field>` on my mobile app, where no date/time placeholders are displayed, so I want the label to only float if a value has been entered in these inputs. Currently the label always floats and so these inputs look inconsistent.

I think currently the only way to accomplish this would be to create a custom form field control, but there is a lot of boilerplate code I have to write to make it otherwise behave the same as a standard `matInput`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(input): customize never empty input types" (#26977)

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): mat-table header fails to change theme on iOS
Issues.Body:
### Description

When changing theme dynamically, header of `mat-table` fails to update on iOS. It retains colors from the previously active theme.

No other component in the library shows such behavior, including other parts of the table, which all update correctly. The issue is specific to iOS, and just with the header of `mat-table`. Works fine in any other OS.

### Expected Behavior

Must update table header when active theme changes.

### Actual Behavior

Keeps colors from the previous theme.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.7
- CDK/Material: 15.2.7
- Browser(s): Safari (latest)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iPhone 11 Pro

**UPDATE**

If I click a button in my UI that brings up an overlay object - `mat-menu`, then the color artifact is removed, i.e. table headers get their color updated correctly. Not sure what is going on. But it looks like an overlay object can send some update request, which is handled by everything.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(COMPONENT): mat-table header fails to change theme on iOS" (#26975)
